Module nbbrd.picocsv
Package nbbrd.picocsv

Class Csv.ReaderOptions

java.lang.Object
nbbrd.picocsv.Csv.ReaderOptions
Enclosing class:
Csv
public static final class Csv.ReaderOptions extends Object
CSV reader options. Defines how the reader behaves.

This class is immutable and is created by a builder. 

 Csv.ReaderOptions options = Csv.ReaderOptions.builder().lenientSeparator(false).build();

  • Method Details

    • isLenientSeparator

      public boolean isLenientSeparator()
      Determines if the format separator is parsed leniently or not when dealing with dual characters (first-char + second-char) such as Csv.Format.WINDOWS_SEPARATOR.

      A lenient parsing considers a line to be terminated either:

      • if the read char is the first-char possibly followed immediately by the second-char
      • if the read char is the second-char
      • if the end-of-file is reached

      For example, if the format separator is Csv.Format.WINDOWS_SEPARATOR, the reader follows the same behavior as BufferedReader: "a line is considered to be terminated by any one of a line feed ('\n'), a carriage return ('\r'), a carriage return followed immediately by a line feed, or by reaching the end-of-file (EOF)".

      The default value is false.

      Returns:
      true if lenient parsing of separator, false otherwise

    • getMaxCharsPerField

      public int getMaxCharsPerField()
      Determines the maximum number of characters to read in each field to avoid OutOfMemoryError in case a file does not have a valid format. This sets a limit which avoids unwanted JVM crashes.

      The default value is 4096.

      Returns:
      the maximum number of characters for a field

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Checks if the current options are valid.

      Validation rules:

      • maximum number of characters for a field must be positive
      Returns:
      true if valid, false otherwise
